Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior streakily glazed (fired reddish); lotus bud in faded white outline with added red centre above two faded white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: A paper label is glued to the inner surface with the number '12' and the same number is written on the exterior. The number '103' is written in pencil on the inner surface. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on the exterior surface make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1457) (phase 2)
